com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSAddAdditionalKeyDataUE


  • public interface YFSAddAdditionalKeyDataUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addAdditionalKeyData(YFSEnvironment env, java.lang.String transactionId, java.lang.String eventId, java.util.Map keyData, int DataType, java.lang.Object data)
      The YFSAddAdditionalKeyDataUE user exit is called whenever additional data has to be added to keyData for condition evaluation.

    • Method Detail

      • addAdditionalKeyData

        boolean addAdditionalKeyData(YFSEnvironment env,
                             java.lang.String transactionId,
                             java.lang.String eventId,
                             java.util.Map keyData,
                             int DataType,
                             java.lang.Object data)
                      throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSAddAdditionalKeyDataUE user exit is called whenever additional data has to be added to keyData for condition evaluation. When an event is raised, a set of data (key data) is passed to the event which is used for condition evaluation. If any conditions have been associated with events that are made of condition variables other than what is published by default in the key data set, then this user exit can be implemented to append event specific data to the key data map. The extra values appended to key data will now be used for condition evaluation.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Pre-conditions: The user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The additional keyData has to be populated. If it is NULL, previous keyData will be taken for condition evaluation.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API. This is required for the user exit to either raise errors or access environment information.
        transactionId - Transaction ID, which must be defined on the Platform database.
        eventId - Event ID, which must be defined on the Platform database.
        keyData - This is an output parameter. Append additional data here.
        DataType - 0 if data is java.util.Map or 1 if data is java.lang.String which contains an XML document.
        data - Any additional information passed to the user exit to populate the keyData.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
